meta.title: Operation of Digital Tablet Hardness Tester

sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Digital Tablet Hardness Tester for measurement of crushing strength or hardness of pharmaceutical tablets.
sections.scope: Applicable to tablet hardness testing activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the hardness tester is placed on a stable, level surface.
Verify that the instrument is clean and free from tablet debris.
Power ON the digital hardness tester and allow it to initialize.
Perform instrument zeroing or calibration as per manufacturer instructions.
If calibration is required, use certified calibration standards.
Set the unit of measurement (kg, N, or kP) as per requirement.
Select appropriate jaw size or attachment based on tablet shape and size.
Take at least 10 tablets randomly from the batch for testing.
Remove any loose dust from tablet surface using soft brush or air.
Place the first tablet between the jaws ensuring proper positioning.
For round tablets, position radially between the jaws.
For capsule-shaped tablets, position lengthwise.
Press the test button or handle to initiate crushing.
The jaws will close gradually until the tablet breaks.
Record the hardness value displayed on the digital screen.
Remove tablet fragments from the jaws carefully.
Repeat the test for remaining tablets in the sample set.
Calculate average hardness and standard deviation.
Verify that hardness values are within specified limits.
Clean the jaws and instrument after testing to remove tablet debris.
Document all hardness readings and calculations in the quality control record.
precautions: Handle tablets carefully to avoid chipping or damage before testing.
Ensure proper tablet positioning for accurate and reproducible results.
Do not test tablets that are chipped, broken, or defective.
Clean jaws between different batches to prevent cross-contamination.
Perform regular calibration to ensure accuracy of measurements.
Do not apply excessive force manually if using semi-automatic testers.
Protect the instrument from dust and moisture.
Replace worn or damaged jaws promptly.
Perform testing at controlled room temperature and humidity.
Dispose of tested tablets as per sampling and testing procedures.
